name: i_love_kate
text:
I'm not going to lie. If find most of Socks' comments hilarious.

Also, what is the reasoning behind who has spam-marking privileges? A bunch of comments up there have been marked spam for just being linked to Socks and his tirade, which is worrisome.

name: blitztrug
text: i just don't think anyone is allowed spam-marking privileges or lames anymore. i've only had one lame to give since i joined.

name: focip
text: base defended sir.

name: howl
text: Hmm. This being a comic-strip world, I wonder if Beef noticed this unconventional spelling and that's why he told Milklin to "knock [himself] out."

name: aliiis
text: Ok yep but at first I thought he was trying to knock himself out as per Beef's instruction. WAS I THE ONLY ONE.

name: peecat
text: No - I thought so too...

name: aliiis
text: I would feel all vindicated-like, but... by a pee cat?? I'm not sure that is wise :|

name: peecat
text: My cat has bladder issues. I'd like to know what Ray would make of her. Beef would understand.

name: dusty
text: I figured that having succeeded at the most basic part of his job, where he usually fails, he simply failed at standing there.

name: imitationcrab
text: what on earth happened here in the comments with all the spam?  it's like scrolling through a post-apocalyptic message board

name: socks
text: A comment left by socks was marked as spam and excluded. socks: What a douche. (reported by Nurdbot, NYU, CarlG)

name: saru
text: OMG. I love that a post-apocalyptic message board a) exists (is it one old computer-lover left alive, actually just messaging himself a lot?), and b) just has a lot of filtered spam.

i seem to have walked into the WWII of message spamming.

achewood's message boards make me feel nervous.

anyway, milkin is a fabulous name and i like his tail

text: Yeah, what happened here? Its like one of those eery deserted space stations, bodies piled up to the roof. Or maybe like the battleground at the end of 300. I don't understand base. Rad strip but. Rad.

text: Every Zig has been taken off, though. For great justice.

name: poing
text: A comment left by poing was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by AndrewofDOOM, JenH, ifergott, HonestTom, Deusoma, Firehawk, fattypneumonia, juanclaudius, Njury, mugi, choosebro, bixschmix, achilleselbow, Direhaggis, Doc_Rostov, echidnaboy)

name: deusoma
text: My amazing psychic powers tell me you forgot to take your crazy pills on that day two months ago. I'm going to assume you're not normally that much of a douchebag, and continue happily on my way.

name: zoeofdoom
text: nah, i'd forget i was on the internets if i ignored all the crazies and their delicious madness.

name: mountaindewtab
text: I was a jehovahs witness once

name: tim_simmons
text: nice avatar, praise jah.

name: forshame
text:
One of my best childhood friends became a Jehovah's Witness not too long ago under pressure from his family. It was weird to hear him change into someone who could feel allright with keeping a hypothetically posed blood transfusion from his little brother. He was given assurance that the coming apocalypse would reunite them...

It's a dick move to cheer on the apocalypse.

name: soticoto
text: Cheering on the apocalypse is just cheering for the winners: it'd be stupid not to.

name: baryonyx
text:
I-

But-

...hm.

name: mattylite
text: Soticoto you ust blew my mind.

name: mattylite
text: J ust.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: *...blew your comment to pieces.

name: aperson
text: I'm an atheist and even I keep a hypothetically posed blood transfusion from my little brother. Doesn't everyone?

name: aperson
text: Sigh. I made a bbcode comment on an html website about an hour ago.

name: dasilodavi
text: I feel like there should be a "Pif!" sound effect in panel 6 when Roast Beef blocks the door frame with his arm.  Guess I've gotten spoiled on details.

name: soupkaty
text: Ah wow. I can't recall the first strip I read, but this is the first one I printed off and taped in the little half-finished room where I practice drums sometimes.

name: phthoggos
text: That is adorable!

name: soupkaty
text:
Hm. I can't tell if you mean that in a good or a sarcastic way.
Neither one necessarily travels over the internet very well.

name: phthoggos
text: 90% the good way.

name: andrewofdoom
text:
Your avatars are so intense!

Banana!

Rabbit!

Banana!

Rabbit!

name: tekende
text: V. V. V. V. V.

name: dumase
text:
there is no reason that this strip should be rated below a 4.0
it is not one of the best but it is certainly not 3.anything material. i mean how often does Beef lay out some quality sass on strangers?

name: chuchurocket
text: no one should be a cock to a stranger. ever.

name: soticoto
text:
How are you Socks

All your base are belong to us

You have no chance to survive make your time

Ha ha ha ha !!

name: deusoma
text: The fact that you went to the trouble to italicize the exclamation points makes this the best rendition of this meme I've seen in a long while.

name: soticoto
text:
Let me clarify something:

I owned Zero Wing.
I knew CATS before he was famous.

name: i_love_kate
text: I played it, if that counts.

name: mrklaw
text: Socks you are the worst song played on the ugliest guitar.

name: joamiq
text: That this strip is not rated more highly is a travesty.

name: hellofditties
text: I agree entirely!

name: sneeeeeeeeeeeze
text: A comment left by sneeeeeeeeeeeze was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, apocowarg, ActualTaunt, Satyr)

name: dasuta
text: This song is almost as good as Samuel H Invisible.   Onstad, you have a knack for songs.

name: direhaggis
text: The giant nailed shoe of Jehova's Witness punts Milkin into the Chaise Lounge of the Eternally Damned. Its elegant frame and dutiful appointments is the first to be engulfed in white hellfire and free tumblers of single malt whiskey come the Apocalypse.

name: tehloki
text:
Dude I feel kinda bad for socks now

Anything he says in the future will be automatically lame, no matter how rad

name: zorglemeister
text:
Let's see... RB getting his sass on and being such as the lash with the denial of entry. Good.
Wasteland of comments below. Amazing.
Silly song about Milklin. Sweet.
The combination of the three. Priceless.

name: sneeeeeeeeeeeze
text: Whose base was this again?

name: kickstart
text: Beef looks cool in his swim trunks.

name: molesticide
text:
having waded through all those spammed comments, honestly i have to say that the original concept (claiming the comic as his 'base' on the internet), though poorly executed, was actually kind of funny. just because a dude uses capslock is no reason to spam him. i refuse to touch bbcode, so anytime i want to emphasize something, i capitalize it.

that guy socks just had SO MUCH passion for what he was saying, man.

name: griggs_although
text: Tell me, whose base was this comic strip? Tell me? Whose?

name: griggs_although
text: touch bbcode

name: stagnantdisplay
text: JWs don't wear name tags...

name: lechatbotte
text:
Yeah, but this one is a warning, not an advertisment, so it's cool.

Besides, for all we know, JW cats might.

name: goatmasterflash
text: Yeah. It's Mormons/Latter Day Saints who wear name tags, white shirts and dark ties. Milklin should look Mormonism when he gets kicked out of the JW's.

name: sock
text: I suddenly regret not using a different screenname.

name: fineoakstructure
text: His base turned out to be the Maginot Line.

name: fattypneumonia
text: No, NO sock! Don't be regretful. You are RAD!  YOU!  ARE!  RAD!!!!

name: duperando
text: I think my favorite part about this strip is the fact that the little diddy in the last four panels doesn't make any dang sense as a song. You'd have to have a pretty weird time signature to be able to compose a song supporting lyrics like that.
